description: This survey course challenges students to break out of their European protective shields and
"imaginings" and to think globally, while appreciating the contributions of other civilizations
that have had such a telling impact on the modern world. Through a rigorous analysis of a list of
primary sources and assigned reading, the course examines the significant political, religious,
social and economic developments of humankind, and strives for the global perspective. Some
